chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Lindemann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

supervisions.notes: Apply 9 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
No violent contact with the victim.
Anger Management to be determined by Agent.
DNA sample is waived.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 9/01/2017 or penalty of 4 days Jail for non-payment.

Straight time to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 130 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 4.
Apply 9 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 3.  DNA sample is waived.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are waived.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time to commence FORTHWITH.
Concurrent with: Count 3.

Defendant Tyler J Lindemann in court, in custody, with attorney Liana M Kapelke-Dale.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendations. Attorney Kapelke-Dale makes statements. Defendant makes statements.

Court orders the following:  Count #3

9 months Straight Time to commence FORTHWITH. Credit for 130 days. Concurrent to Count #4.

Costs are to be as originally set. Unpaid costs are to be paid at a rate of $25.00/month to begin 9/1/17. Failure to pay - for every $50.00 not paid, defendant to serve 1 day in Waukesha County Jail consecutive to sentence. 

**********************************************************

Court orders the following:  Count #4

90 days Straight Time to commence FORTHWITH. Concurrent to Count #3.

Costs are to be as originally set. Unpaid costs are to be paid at a rate of $25.00/month to begin 9/1/17. Failure to pay - for every $50.00 not paid, defendant to serve 1 day in Waukesha County Jail consecutive to sentence.

Court orders the following:

Count 3:
- Sentence withheld.  (Credit for 9 days if revoked.)
- 2 years Probation.

- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Continue with AODA treatment/counseling.  No violent contact with victim.  Anger Management to be determined by Agent. 

Count 4:

- 2 years Probation. 
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

- DNA Surcharge waived
